item.title: Parliament Winter Session 2024 Day 17 LIVE updates: BJP against Caste Census, giving ‘jumlas’ to befool everyone and then blame us: Kharge in RS - The Hindu
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: ‘Ambedkar opposed Art 370’, claims Hardeep Puri in Rajya Sabha

Date & Source: December 16, 2024 - The Hindu

The Parliament is currently in its winter session, with significant discussions on constitutional matters taking place. Key highlights from the session include statements from Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticizing the Congress party and remarks from Hardeep Puri on Article 370.

  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman denounces the Congress party as 'anti-women' for their stance on the Women’s Reservation Bill.
  • Hardeep Puri asserts that Dr. B.R. Ambedkar opposed Article 370, citing historical context and urging that the Congress party failed to act appropriately.
  • Debates are ongoing about inflation, economic policies, and women's rights in the context of India's parliamentary system.
“What should have been a temporary arrangement gained a permanent nature because the Congress did not have the courage to Act,” said Hardeep Puri.

This session has revealed deep political divides and ongoing controversies regarding the legacy and future of the Indian Constitution.

item.title: Stricter anti-pollution measures reinforced in Delhi as AQI drops amid cold wave - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Stricter Anti-Pollution Measures Reinforced in Delhi as AQI Drops Amid Cold Wave

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's air quality panel has invoked the third phase of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP-3) in Delhi-NCR due to poor air quality and a cold wave affecting the region.

  • GRAP-3 imposes a ban on non-essential construction and strict vehicle regulations in response to rising pollution.
  • The AQI surged into the 'very poor' category, prompting governmental action.
  • Current temperatures have dropped significantly, exacerbating pollution levels.
  • Restrictions include prohibiting petrol vehicles not meeting BS-III norms and diesel vehicles failing to comply with BS-IV standards.
  • Dust suppression methods have been enhanced, including mechanized road-sweeping and water-sprinkling.
  • Diesel generators are limited to emergency use only due to their contribution to pollution.
The Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 351, indicating 'very poor' air quality.

This decision highlights the urgent actions being taken to combat pollution in Delhi while contending with harsh weather conditions that complicate air quality management.

item.title: Sri Lankan president Dissanayake meets PM Modi in Delhi, vows not to use country’s territory for anti-India activities - The Indian Express
item.description:
Sri Lankan president Dissanayake meets PM Modi, vows not to let the country’s territory be used for anti-India activities

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: Indian Express

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that his country will not allow its territory to be used for activities that harm India while meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi. He expressed gratitude for India's support during Sri Lanka's economic crisis.

  • The two leaders discussed strengthening bilateral ties and cooperation.
  • They signed agreements on avoiding double taxation and capacity building.
  • Topics included maritime security, cyber security, and infrastructure projects like the Sampur solar power project.
  • Dissanayake's visit marks his first overseas trip since taking office.
“The visit of President Dissanayake to India shall further strengthen the multifaceted and mutually beneficial cooperation between the two countries,” stated the MEA spokesperson.

President Dissanayake's commitment to India's security concerns illustrates a strategic approach to maintain solid diplomatic relations.

item.title: 'Ban Free Online Pornography, Castrate Rapists' : PIL Seeks Measures For Women Safety; Supreme Court... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Examines PIL for Women's Safety and Regulation of Online Pornography

Publication Date: Today | Source: News Agency

The Supreme Court has taken notice of a public interest litigation (PIL) requesting national guidelines to enhance the safety of women in India, including a ban on free online pornography and castration of convicted sex offenders.

  • The PIL aims to implement pan-India safety guidelines and address the vulnerabilities of women, particularly in public transport.
  • A significant part of the plea is to evaluate the effectiveness of existing laws concerning violence against women and children.
  • The court recognized some proposals as innovative while expressing concern over others being potentially barbaric.
  • Senior Advocate Mahalakshmi Pavani represented the PIL, highlighting ongoing incidents of violence against women and the media's role in underreporting such cases.
  • Calls for CCTV installation in workplaces and fast-tracking trials for sexual offenses are included, alongside preventing accused politicians from contesting elections.
“The easy access to pornographic material has a direct link with the spurt in sexual offenses across the country.”

This hearing coincides with the anniversary of the Nirbhaya gangrape incident, emphasizing the ongoing need for systemic changes regarding women's safety in India.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi carries ‘Palestine’ bag to Parliament, BJP says ‘appeasement’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi Carries 'Palestine' Bag to Parliament, BJP Criticizes 'Appeasement'

Date: Dec 16, 2024, Source: Hindustan Times

Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has made headlines by carrying a bag adorned with 'Palestine' to Parliament, expressing her support for the Palestinian cause. This act has sparked a backlash from BJP leaders who accuse her of political appeasement.

  • Priyanka Gandhi carried a bag with 'Palestine' and emblems symbolizing solidarity during the Winter Session of Parliament.
  • Congress spokesperson Dr. Shama Mohammed emphasized this as a gesture of compassion and a commitment to justice.
  • Vadra has actively condemned Israeli actions in Gaza, referring to them as genocidal.
  • BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra criticized the gesture, linking it to historical political failures of the Gandhi family.
“It is the moral responsibility of every right-thinking individual… to condemn the Israeli government's genocidal actions and force them to stop,” Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated.

This incident highlights the ongoing political divide regarding international issues and the role of public figures in expressing solidarity with global causes.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: BJP against Caste Census, giving ‘jumlas’ to befool everyone and then blame us: Kharge in RS - The Hindu
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17 Highlights: Priyanka Gandhi Calls for Action Against Atrocities on Hindus in Bangladesh

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The 17th day of the Winter session of Parliament included significant discussions regarding atrocities faced by Hindus in Bangladesh, with Priyanka Gandhi urging action from the government. The session also saw Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman attacking the Congress party for historical constitutional amendments.

  • Priyanka Gandhi asserts the government's failure to address threats to Hindus in Bangladesh.
  • Nirmala Sitharaman criticizes Congress for not passing the Women's Reservation Bill.
  • Kharge accuses PM Modi of living in the past and not addressing current achievements.
  • Discussions focus on the historical significance of the Constitution and its role in governance.
  • K.C. Venugopal condemns the absence of the Finance Minister during critical discussions on the economy.
“The Congress party carried out major amendments to the Constitution to brazenly help the ‘family’ and the ‘dynasty’” - Nirmala Sitharaman.

The session reflected ongoing political tensions and discussions on various critical issues impacting the country's governance.

item.title: Mallikarjun Kharge’s BIG retort to PM Modi over Constitution debate: ‘Those who did not fight for country…’ - Mint
item.description:
Mallikarjun Kharge’s BIG Retort to PM Modi Over Constitution Debate

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge emphasized the importance of adhering to the Constitution and criticized those who previously opposed it.

  • Kharge stated that merely blaming each other is unproductive.
  • He highlighted the historical opposition from the Jan Sangh and RSS to the Constitution.
  • Kharge mentioned acts of burning effigies of key leaders on Constitution Day.
  • He accused the BJP of opposing reservation policies and cast census.
“Those who hated the flag, Ashok Chakra and the Constitution are today teaching lessons to us on the Constitution.” - Mallikarjun Kharge

In conclusion, Kharge's remarks underline a significant clash regarding the interpretation and adherence to the Constitution in contemporary political discourse.

item.title: Sambhal: Broken idols of Hindu deities found near newly uncovered temple, say cops - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Broken Idols Discovered Near Ancient Temple in Sambhal

Date: Dec 16, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Authorities in Sambhal have recovered three broken idols during excavation work near a newly uncovered Hindu temple, which had been closed since 1978.

  • The Shiv-Hanuman Temple was reopened on December 14, 2024.
  • The idols are believed to belong to Lord Ganesh and Lord Kartikeya.
  • The discovery was made during digging for a well.
  • Devotees painted religious slogans on the temple walls.
  • Security measures have been enhanced at the temple.
“The area has been secured so that excavation can be done smoothly,” said Sambhal ASP Shrish Chandra.

This discovery is significant as it coincides with the reopening of the ancient temple, highlighting a revitalization of religious practices in the region amidst recent tensions.

item.title: 'How Is Shouting 'Jai Sriram' Inside Mosque An Offence?' : Supreme Court Asks Complainant, Seeks... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
How Is Shouting 'Jai Sriram' Inside Mosque An Offence?' : Supreme Court Asks Complainant, Seeks...

Date: December 16, 2023

Source: Supreme Court

The Supreme Court sought the stand of the State of Karnataka in a petition challenging the Karnataka High Court's view that shouting 'Jai Sriram' inside a mosque would not amount to an offence.

  1. The Supreme Court bench, consisting of Justices Pankaj Mithal and Sandeep Mehta, is hearing a petition against the Karnataka High Court's judgment.
  2. The High Court had quashed criminal proceedings against two persons accused of trespassing in a mosque and shouting 'Jai Sriram'.
  3. Senior Advocate Devadatt Kamat, representing the complainant, argued that shouting a religious slogan in another religious place would amount to inciting communal disharmony.
  4. The bench questioned whether merely being near the mosque would mean the accused shouted the slogans.
  5. Kamat clarified that the complainant is only the caretaker of the mosque and it is the police's responsibility to investigate and collect evidence.
The High Court observed, 'It is un-understandable as to how if someone shouts 'Jai Sriram' it would outrage the religious feeling of any class'.

The bench directed the petitioner to serve a copy of the petition on the State of Karnataka, with the matter to be posted next in January 2025.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Live: Nehru jailed Majrooh Sultanpuri, Balraj Sahni, says Sitharaman - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Live: Cong MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demands restoration of '71 war photo

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

During the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra raised the issue of restoring a historic photo from the 1971 war, emphasizing the need to acknowledge the sacrifices of Indian soldiers.

  • The final week of the Winter Session features debates on key constitutional issues.
  • The government is likely to defer the constitutional amendment bill for simultaneous elections.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the bravery of soldiers and the leadership of Indira Gandhi during the 1971 conflict.
“I want to salute the brave soldiers who fought for us in the war of 1971,” said Priyanka Gandhi.

The discussions reflect ongoing tensions regarding historical narratives and national memory within Indian politics.

item.title: Congress Reacts After Omar Abdullah Junks Opposition's EVM Charge - NDTV
item.description:
Congress Reacts After Omar Abdullah Junks Opposition's EVM Charge

Publication Date: December 16, 2024   Source: NDTV

The Congress party has criticized ally Omar Abdullah's stance on opposition issues, particularly regarding recent allegations of manipulation of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), after Abdullah dismissed these claims.

  • Omar Abdullah's party, the National Conference, contested the Jammu and Kashmir elections alongside the Congress.
  • Congress parliamentarian Manickam Tagore highlighted differing views on EVMs among opposition parties following recent elections.
  • Recent opposition claims regarding EVM discrepancies were led by Sharad Pawar's NCP and Shiv Sena (UBT).
  • Congress's Working Committee has accused the Election Commission of partisan conduct and hinted at targeted manipulation.
  • Abdullah stated that political parties doubting EVMs should refrain from participating in elections.
Mr. Abdullah stated, "When you get a hundred plus members of parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that... you can't... turn around and say... we don't like these EVMs because now the election results aren't going the way we would like them to."

The debate over EVM integrity showcases significant differences within the opposition and raises questions about electoral processes in India.

item.title: Drug abuse is not ‘cool’: Supreme Court warns India’s youth - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Drug abuse is not ‘cool’: Supreme Court warns India’s youth

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has expressed deep concern over the rise of drug abuse among India’s youth, labeling it a significant societal issue that requires immediate action.

  • Drug abuse is increasingly seen as a symbol of being “cool”.
  • Justice BV Nagarathna warned of severe socio-economic and psychological effects of drug abuse.
  • The court urged collective action from parents, society, and state authorities.
  • It highlighted that drug trade funds violence and terrorism, destabilizing society.
  • The judgment emphasized the importance of providing a nurturing environment for youths.
  • Parents are urged to counteract substance abuse with love and affection.
  • The court called for destigmatizing addiction and supporting rehabilitation initiatives.
  • Educational initiatives and community interventions are crucial to combat this issue.
“Drug abuse cannot be treated as a taboo,” the court stated, urging for open dialogue and preventive measures.

The court’s ruling not only addresses the specific case concerning Ankush Vipan Kapoor but also emphasizes the broader implications of substance abuse on society.

item.title: Plea In Supreme Court Against Yati Narsinghanand's 'Dharam Sansad'; Contempt Action Sought Against Uttar... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Legal Action Sought Against Yati Narsinghanand's 'Dharam Sansad' in Supreme Court

Date & Source: Not specified, Livelaw

Introduction: A contempt petition has been filed against the Uttar Pradesh administration and police for not taking action against the 'Dharam Sansad' organized by Yati Narasinghanand, known for making communal statements targeting the Muslim community.

  • The petitioners include former civil servants and activists who argue that the 'Dharam Sansad' includes hate speeches and incites violence against Muslims.
  • The Ghaziabad District Administration and the Uttar Pradesh police have been accused of failing to act as per Supreme Court directions.
  • Advocate Prashant Bhushan mentioned the matter before the Chief Justice of India for urgent listing.
  • Petitioners include Aruna Roy, Ashok Kumar Sharma, Deb Mukarji, Navrekha Sharma, Syeda Hameed, and Vijayan MJ.
  • The 'Dharam Sansad' events in 2021 led to controversy and Yati Narasinghanand's arrest.
The Supreme Court has issued notice to him in a criminal contempt case over his remarks against the judiciary.

Conclusion: The petition seeks urgent action against the 'Dharam Sansad' to prevent further communal tensions and hate speech.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 16 LIVE Updates: Both Houses set to resume; Amit Shah to lead Constitution debate in Rajya Sabha - The Indian Express
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates

Date & Source: December 16, 2024 - The Indian Express

During the ongoing winter session of Parliament, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticized the Congress party's approach to constitutional amendments, calling them invalid and detrimental to democracy. The session has seen a strong reaction from the opposition.

  • Nirmala Sitharaman attacked Congress for its history of constitutional amendments aimed at consolidating familial power.
  • PM Modi defended his government's constitutional amendments, contrasting them with those made by Congress.
  • Opposition leader Rahul Gandhi made an analogy about cutting off skills from youth, comparing it to a mythological reference.
  • The government has postponed the introduction of the One Nation One Election Bills.
“Like Dronacharya cut the thumb of Eklavya, you are cutting the thumbs of India’s youngsters.” - Rahul Gandhi

The debate continues to generate significant discussion around the implications of constitutional amendments and the influence of political parties on democratic processes.

item.title: 'Why this approach after being CM?': Congress hits back at Omar Abdullah's remark on EVM - The Times of India
item.description:
'Why this approach after being CM?': Congress hits back at Omar Abdullah's remark on EVM

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a recent statement, Congress responded to Omar Abdullah's comments regarding electronic voting machines (EVMs) following his tenure as Chief Minister.

  • Congress criticized Abdullah's questioning of EVM trustworthiness.
  • The party emphasized the need for transparent electoral processes.
  • Omar Abdullah's remarks have sparked debate within political circles.
“It’s questionable why this approach comes only after his time as CM.”

The ongoing discourse highlights the political tensions surrounding election integrity and the use of technology in voting.

item.title: Delhi shivers amid coldwave conditions as minimum drops to 4.5°C; AQI ‘very poor’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Coldwave: Minimum Temperature Falls to 4.5°C Amid 'Very Poor' Air Quality

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Coldwave conditions continue to grip Delhi, with a recorded minimum temperature of 4.5°C, marking the joint lowest this season.

  • Minimum temperature recorded at Safdarjung dropped to 4.5°C, four degrees below normal.
  • Shallow fog resulted in visibility of around 800 metres.
  • Air quality index (AQI) reached 'very poor' levels, averaging 351.
  • Experts link the deterioration in AQI to a drop in wind speed; similar conditions expected to persist.
  • Lowest minimum temperature was recorded at 3.5°C in Pusa and 4°C in Ayanagar.
“A feeble western disturbance is beginning to impact northwest India, which is slowing down winds. This should keep the AQI likely in the very poor range.” - Mahesh Palawat, Skymet

The coldwave is set to continue, with temperatures predicted to hover around 5°C on Tuesday.
